alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 17 at 3:25AM AKDT until September 17 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by high winds continues * WHERE...Including the Kuskokwim Delta. * WHEN...Until 830 AM AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 316 AM AKDT, High winds from remnants of typhoon Merbok will impact the Bering Sea into this weekend. Southerly winds across Kuskokwim Bay will cause elevated levels on the Kuskokwim River as well as enhanced wave action and erosion. - Specifically for the following communities: Napakiak is likely to experience minor to moderate flooding and erosion is likely. In Bethel minor flooding in the Brown Slough area is possible. For the Tundra Villages of Kasigluk, Nunapitchuk and Atmautluk, there is a possibility that winds could push water levels higher and boardwalks and low lying areas could become flooded. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
